title: Katie Price signs up for Celebrity SAS in desperate bid for attention

Katie Price is reportedly hoping her stint on Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins will help her win back the hearts of the public.

She has been filming for the Channel 4 show which sees celeb contestants get gruelling military training.

Katie's public image could do with a makeover as she has recently landed herself in hot water over her multiple driving offences, messy love life, and "mucky mansion".

She also recently attracted criticism for taking her five-year-old daughter Bunny to a party in knee high stiletto boots.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

But Katie is hoping to put all that behind her as she embarks on her new project.

A source told MailOnline : "After a tough time with her love life and financial worries, Katie is happy to get things on track and get her mind and body in the right place.

"The show is the perfect outlet for her to boost her confidence and regain her fitness.

(Image: YouTube)

"When she left, she was so excited to get stuck in.

"She wants people to see she's still the old Katie that the nation fell in love with on I'm A Celeb."

The businesswoman and former glamour model began filming for the show on Tuesday.

(Image: Channel 4)

The source added that Katie has been working with her personal trainer, Jack, to help her get fit for the show.

In a video uploaded to her YouTube channel, Katie huffed and puffed on a treadmill as she revealed to viewers: I've got five weeks to go until this particular thing I'm training for.

"Even reading the test makes me feel sick."

(Image: Channel 4)

She staggered out of the gym after battling the treadmill challenge, and she told Jack: "I am dying."

The show takes place in the Chilean Andes, and last year's winner was footballer Wayne Bridge.

Love Island's Camilla Thurlow previously featured on the show, and was left defeated after slashing open her hand during a daring challenge.
description: Katie reportedly hopes to win back the public's hearts and boost her confidence on the show
